name: World War 2 Part One Quiz | World War II | 10 Questions

questions.text: Which was not a designation for a World War Two aircraft carrier?
questions.explanation:
CVP.

	CVA-Attack carrier, CVE-Escort carrier, CV- Aircraft carrier.

questions.text: Who of the following was not recognized as a General of the Army (5 Star)?
questions.explanation:
Patton.

	It was a special rank created to recognize outstanding military leaders.

questions.text: Who did not portray General George Patton in the movies?
questions.explanation:
John Wayne.

	George C. Scott-'Patton', Kirk Douglas-'Is Paris Burning?' and George Kennedy-'Brass Target'.

questions.text: Which of the following battleships did not sink at Pearl Harbor?
questions.explanation:
Nevada.

	The Nevada was beached and salvaged.

questions.text: During World War Two, which of the following was rationed first in the United States?
questions.explanation:
Sugar.

	Sugar-May 1942, Coffee- November 1942, Soft cheese and canned milk in 1943.

questions.text: Which of the following was not 'Time' magazine's 'Man of the Year' during World War Two?
questions.explanation:
Truman.

	Stalin-1939 and 1942 and FDR-1941. Churchill was man of the year in 1940.

questions.text: Which of the following was not a bomber?
questions.explanation:
P-51.

	The P-51 was a fighter called the Mustang. The B-29 was called the superfortress, B-24 the Liberator and the B-17 the Flying Fortress.

questions.text: Which one of the following did not serve in the army?
questions.explanation:
Tony Curtis.

	Tony Curtis was in the navy.

questions.text: Which was not a World War Two aircraft carrier?
questions.explanation:
USS Forrestal.

	The Forrestal was built after the war.

questions.text: Which was not part of the phonetic alphabet during World War Two?
questions.explanation:
Brandy.

	Baker was used during the war later replaced by bravo.
